articles.title: ‘When did I say that I am anti-Messi?’: Argentina forward at World Cup defends her Cristiano Ronaldo tattoo
articles.description: “Messi is our great captain in the national team, but just because I say that my inspiration and idol is CR7, it doesn’t mean I hate Messi,” she said.
articles.content:
An Argentina forward who has a Cristiano Ronaldo tattoo wants fans to stop criticizing her for idolizing the Portugal star instead of national hero Lionel Messi.

articles.title: Not anti-Messi: Argentina's Rodriguez defends Ronaldo tattoo
articles.description: Argentina forward Yamila Rodriguez has defended herself for having a tattoo of Cristiano Ronaldo inked on her left shin, saying that favouring the Portugal star is not a sign she does not appreciate their World Cup-winning talisman Lionel Messi.
articles.content: July 26 (Reuters) - Argentina forward Yamila Rodriguez has defended herself for having a tattoo of Cristiano Ronaldo inked on her left shin, saying that favouring the Portugal star is not a sign she does not appreciate their World Cup-winning talisma... [1307 chars]

articles.title: Soccer-Messi feasts as Miami thrash Atlanta 4-0
articles.description: Lionel Messi scored two first half goals and assisted on another in the second to lead Inter Miami to a 4-0 dismantling of Atlanta United and advance to the knockout stage of the Leagues Cup on Tuesday. After coming off the bench to score a dramatic game winner in his debut on Friday night, the newly minted team captain from Argentina wasted no time in his first start with the MLS side.

articles.description: Argentina legend Lionel Messi has enjoyed his start to life at Manchester United icon David Beckham's MLS club
articles.content:

articles.title: AI imagines kids of victims kidnapped during Argentina dictatorship
articles.description: A project by Argentine artist Santiago Barros uses artificial intelligence to imagine what the children of those who disappeared during the country's bloody military dictatorship (1976-1983) would look like today.
articles.content: [1/4] Argentine art director Santiago Barros, 46, looks at a portrait he generated with the artificial intelligence app Midjourney, recreating by imagining how the son of Marta Bugnone and Jorge Ayastuy, who disappeared during Argentina's last dictat... [2459 chars]

articles.title: IMF sees drought causing Argentina contraction of 2.5% in 2023
articles.description: The International Monetary Fund said on Tuesday it is now projecting Argentina's economy will contract 2.5% in 2023, with a year-end inflation rate of about 120%, largely due to a crippling drought that has curtailed agricultural production.
articles.content: WASHINGTON, July 25 (Reuters) - The International Monetary Fund said on Tuesday it is now projecting Argentina's economy will contract 2.5% in 2023, with a year-end inflation rate of about 120%, largely due to a crippling drought that has curtailed a... [1143 chars]

articles.title: Insight: Some Airbnb hosts try to beat Argentina's inflation with dollar rates and tax avoidance
articles.description: As Argentina's inflation rate soared past 100% and the value of the currency slid, IT worker Luis, 33, found an economic lifeline: renting out his apartment on Airbnb for coveted dollars and finding a way to hide his earnings from the tax authorities.

articles.title: ATP roundup: Dominic Thiem ekes out win in Croatia
articles.description: Austria's Dominic Thiem defeated qualifier Facundo Bagnis of Argentina 6-4, 7-5 in the first round of the Plava Laguna Croatia Open Umag on Monday.
articles.content:
July 25 - Austria's Dominic Thiem defeated qualifier Facundo Bagnis of Argentina 6-4, 7-5 in the first round of the Plava Laguna Croatia Open Umag on Monday.

articles.title: Argentina introduces more peso exchange rates amid IMF loan review
articles.description: Argentina on Monday set new weaker trade-related exchange rates while keeping the official peso rate stable, in a push to meet expectations in its $44 billion agreement with the International Monetary Fund while avoiding a politically costly devaluation.
